item.title: Barbeques Galore enters receivership as debt burns into bottom line
item.description: Barbeques Galore has plunged into receivership, leaving question marks for nearly 100 stores that employ about 500 staff.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Gardener accused of killing Darwin mum in yard deemed 'unfit' to face trial, court hears
item.description: A gardener accused of murdering a Darwin mum in her backyard in 2022 has been deemed 'unfit' to face trial. The case has been delayed while investigations into Joerg Kloepper's mental state and ability to plead were conducted.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Teen bounces back from nasty crash to snatch gold from American great
item.description: Two-time Winter Olympic champion Chloe Kim is pipped for first place by 17-year-old Gaon Choi late in the women's snowboard halfpipe final at the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Children prescribed puberty blockers without proper assessment at Cairns health service, review finds
item.description: The review of the Cairns paediatric gender health service found that children as young as 12 were given puberty blockers inconsistently and without formal consent.

item.title: Angus Taylor to challenge for Liberal leadership
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Cooper Woods wins Australia's first gold of 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Cooper Woods has stunned the moguls field to win a maiden career title at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games at Milano Cortina.

item.title: Cooper Woods welcomed to the Winter Olympic 'gold medal club' by Alisa Camplin-Warner
item.description: Only seven Australian athletes have ever felt the weight of a Winter Olympic gold medal being hung around their necks. And one of the first, Alisa Camplin-Warner, was thrilled to welcome the most recent, Cooper Woods, to the club.

item.title: Donald Trump's border tsar Tom Homan announces ICE withdrawal from Minnesota
item.description: An immigration crackdown in the Midwestern state has been marred by protests and public anger after the shooting of two US citizens by federal agents.

item.title: Liberal Party poised to dump first female federal leader
item.description: The Liberal Party is poised to dump its first federal female leader, with Sussan Ley's supporters acknowledging her rival, Angus Taylor, is in the "ascendancy".

item.title: 3,100 aged care patients stranded in hospitals as states again press Commonwealth for action
item.description: With the ink still wet on a new hospital deal, state and territory health ministers will today use a meeting with their federal counterpart to call for urgent action on stranded patients.

item.title: Water utility 'confident' Hobart drinking water is antibiotic-free after salmon disease outbreak
item.description: Tasmania's water provider says there is no risk of antibiotics entering Hobart's water supply, following Huon Aquaculture's use of oxytetracycline in the River Derwent to treat a disease outbreak.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.title: Cooper Woods, Australia's unexpected Winter Olympic champion, finds his purpose
item.description: Cooper Woods came into the 2026 Winter Olympic Games ranked 22nd in the World Cup rankings in moguls. But in finding his purpose, he roared to a glorious gold medal.

item.title: ASX boss to depart as another controversy unfolds
item.description: A decade of technology failures, unplanned outages, management upheaval, irate investors and the torching of hundreds of millions of dollars has left the ASX's reputation in shreds.

item.title: Epstein survivor says release of files was 're-traumatising' and falls short of transparency
item.description: Lisa Phillips says the publication of the "Epstein" files was meant to deliver long-promised transparency but has instead exposed victims, deepened trauma and continued to shield powerful men.

item.title: Angus Taylor is the new leader of the Liberal Party. Who is he?
item.description: After months of speculation, Liberals hope Angus Taylor can bring the Liberals back from what many in the party fear is the edge of obscurity.

item.title: Economist Bruce Preston appointed to RBA Board
item.description: The economics professor is the second academic economist added to the board since a review recommended boosting its expertise.

item.title: The Christchurch terrorist changed New Zealand, now he is testing its legal system
item.description: It may be months before New Zealand finds out if the Christchurch terrorist will be granted an application to have his guilty pleas vacated.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.title: Marine biologists fight to save endangered seagrass species in Sydney Harbour
item.description: A centuries-old nautical technique is being redesigned within a small Sydney cove in a bid to save a tiny remnant population of a dying species.

item.description: Farmers and agricultural workers are taking to social media to educate a new audience while building a community.

item.description: A study from Deakin University has found many young women admit skipping meals or forgoing medical attention to save money.

item.title: Openly gay men in elite sport are rare, leaving women to lead the way for queer inclusion
item.description: While high profile instances of homophobia in elite men's sport continue, leading female athletes are hoping to help create more inclusive spaces for all.

item.title: Consumers back call for country-of-origin labels on timber sold in Australia
item.description: Consumer advocates and the wood products industry say it is time the origin of timber was made clear, as imports grow year-on-year.

item.title: What a 566yo coolabah tree in the Gwydir Wetlands could tell us about climate
item.description: New research shows some of the coolabahs and river red gums in the Gwydir Wetlands, New South Wales are hundreds of years old, and hold important climate history.

item.description: Sussan Ley announces she will quit the parliament after losing her leadership to Angus Taylor, setting up a by-election in her seat.

item.title: NT Australian of the Year Felix Ho volunteers thousands of hours to the community each year
item.description: Finding time to volunteer can be a stretch for most people, but for Darwin doctor Felix Ho, who volunteers thousands of hours every year, it's his "full-time hobby".

item.title: Share market tumbles on 'traditional Friday 13 meltdown' — as it happened
item.description: Market analysts have blamed a share market sell-off on an increasing trend that is resulting in heavy stock selling as investors fear a meltdown on Wall Street's last day of trade for the week. Look back on the day's business developments in our blog.

item.description: Australia's National Anti-Scam Centre says documents seized in a raid on a Cambodian scam compound contained the phone numbers, names and addresses of 300 Australians.

item.description: After experiencing the Bondi terror attack in December, this composer's new music grew to encompass love's power to heal us from hate and harm.

item.description: Experts say you don't need to pull out the entire contents of a cupboard, beginning with one bag is best.

item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.description: Cam Bolton's broken neck hangs heavily over the Australian snowboard cross team, with his late replacement Jimmy Johnstone vowing his appearance was "all for him".

item.description: The ACT Brumbies have turned up the heat to blitz the Western Force 56-24 in a sapping season-opening Super Rugby Pacific clash in Perth.

item.title: Dry January hits southern Australia as east coast lows drop off the radar
item.description: Rainfall was below average for most of Australia's south-east, far-west and central regions in the first month of the year.

item.title: How a pocket of Sydney's inner west went from Australia's deepest coal mine to waterfront houses
item.description: What was once a working class, coal-fuelled borough is now a sought-after suburb in Sydney's inner west, with houses selling for millions.

item.title: Sharing emergency resources becoming more complicated as fire and flood seasons overlap
item.description: With fires and floods occurring simultaneously, and overlapping with international deployments, sharing critical resources is becoming an increasingly complex task.

item.title: Police block road near Nancy Guthrie's home during investigation into her disappearance
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of American morning show host Savannah Guthrie's mother seal off a road near Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home.

item.title: Destanee Aiava announces retirement, calls out online trolls and 'racist' tennis culture
item.description: Australian tennis player Destanee Aiava says 2026 will be her last year in professional tennis, announcing her impending retirement in an expletive-laden statement on social media.

item.title: Canberra Broulee Nippers Club is helping landlocked city kids become aspiring lifesavers
item.description: Young nippers are sprinting for flags, paddle boards and practising CPR despite the nearest beach being 150 kilometres away.

item.title: South Molle's damaged jetty restricts access to island, with abandoned resort's future unclear
item.description: South Molle Island's former resort has been abandoned since it was damaged by a cyclone in 2017. Now, public access to the island is restricted after Cyclone Koji wreaked havoc on its jetty.

item.title: Woodstock Farm program helping steer troubled Queensland youth away from life of crime
item.description: The rural-based social program in the shadow of Mt Tamborine has had remarkable success in rebuilding the lives of youth who have fallen through the cracks.

item.title: Faaletino Tavana scores stunning try in NRL trial, Canterbury Bulldogs star Matt Burton limps off
item.description: Wests Tigers rookie Faaletino Tavana has laid claim to one of the best tries in 2026 during a preseason trial against the Sydney Roosters.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: Forbes Inn fire
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Unscrupulous NDIS providers using inducements to recruit remote NT participants
item.description: People with disabilities in remote Northern Territory communities are being targeted by unscrupulous NDIS providers using high-pressure sales tactics and inducements including cash, cigarettes and alcohol, an ABC investigation can reveal.

item.title: NT film industry on national stage as Kangaroo, Top End Bub and Journey Home win AACTA Awards
item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Condoms run out at the Olympic Village as cheating chaos rocks curling — quick hits from day eight
item.description: Protective gear is in short supply in Italy as tensions boil over in the curling and a Norwegian-born Brazilian makes history. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Fortescue trials battery-electric locomotives in Pilbara as decarbonisation race tightens
item.description: After years of delays, the Pilbara's largest carbon emitters are testing greener ways to haul iron ore, and Andrew Forrest has now joined their ranks.

item.title: Italian migrants who brought 'fancy cheese' to Australia
item.description: When John Interlandi's father began making "fancy cheese" in Gippsland, few Australians had heard of parmesan. At 90 years old, Mr Interlandi is still perfecting it.

item.title: AFL State of Origin coaches hail success of concept following Victoria's win over Western Australia
item.description: Winning Victoria coach Chris Scott and his Western Australia counterpart Dean Cox call for State of Origin to be played every year after the concept's stunning return in Perth.

item.title: NSW premier announces extra public holiday in April for Anzac Day
item.description: New South Wales has the fewest public holidays in Australia, observing only 11.

item.title: Supporting and connecting Deaf people, Olivia finds her calling more than just a job
item.description: Olivia Jackson, who lost her hearing as a child, has felt invisible for over a decade until she found her true calling to help other Deaf people achieve their goals as a support worker.

item.title: WA hop growers gear up for harvest as craft beer tastes evolve
item.description: Local brewers are experimenting with new flavours, while some farms invest in US-made machinery to modernise and streamline the harvest process.

item.title: As Jakara Anthony dealt with her singles moguls crash, her coach worked out how to pick her back up
item.description: As Jakara Anthony dealt with the disappointment of her singles moguls crash, her coach Peter McNiel was working out how to pick her back up.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot intends to visit ex-husband in prison to get answers on other allegations
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot, the woman at the centre of France's largest rape trial, says she intends to visit her ex-husband in jail and look her abuser "straight in the eye" to get answers to other allegations under investigation.

item.title: Six mysterious deaths in the Balkan Mountains
item.description: Six unsolved deaths in two remote parts of the Balkan Mountains become a source of conspiracy across Bulgaria.

item.title: CCTV of six people hugging before they were found deceased
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: 'Took the wind out of me': Why this man tested himself for plastics
item.description: Kal Glanznig had his urine tested as part of an upcoming documentary exploring plastic pollution in Australia. The results left him speechless.

item.title: Opposition draws battlelines on nuclear and capital gains tax changes
item.description: Deputy Liberal leader Jane Hume says Australia needs to be "open minded" on nuclear power if the country is to bring down emissions and make power cheaper.

item.title: Prime Minister announces $3.9 billion 'down payment' towards $30b Adelaide submarine shipyard
item.description: The South Australian and federal government release plans for the shipyard in Adelaide that will build at least eight nuclear-powered submarines under the AUKUS pact with the US and the UK.

item.title: From succession planning to inherited debt, there's pressure and joy in taking on a family business
item.description: Inheriting a family business comes with the weight of generations past. For these change-makers, the future is in modernising their operation and making it their own.

item.title: How China took over global car manufacturing
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Obama deplores lack of shame after Trump shares monkey clip
item.description: Former US president Barack Obama has criticised a lack of shame and decorum in the country's political discourse, responding for the first time to a post on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted him and first lady Michelle as monkeys.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 9
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Indigenous side overturns 14-0 deficit to down Maori in women's All Stars
item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.title: Frog toxins used to poison Alexei Navalny the latest in long history of Russian chemical attacks
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned by the Kremlin with a rare and lethal toxin found in the skin of poison dart frogs, five European countries have said. It's not the first time the country has been accused of poisoning its enemies.

item.title: Charlotte Mortlock quits Liberal Party following Sussan Ley leadership defeat
item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.title: WA government to introduce new laws on hate speech, face coverings and protests
item.description: The WA premier flags new legislation on hate speech and protests in a bid to protect "social cohesion" in the wake of "multiple threats across Australia" over the summer.

item.title: Indigenous and Māori All Stars play out dramatic 16-all draw
item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.title: Live: Chinese star takes swipe at organisers for not accommodating her schedule
item.description: Chinese skiing superstar Eileen Gu says she is "disappointed" and "saddened" that Winter Olympics organisers scheduled halfpipe training at the same time as her big air final at the MIlano Cortina Games. Follow live.

item.title: New Zealand's North Island braces for more rain amid widespread flooding
item.description: Floods cause power outages, road collapses, home evacuations and are linked to the death of a man whose vehicle was submerged on a highway.

item.title: Matt Graham wins dual moguls bronze at the 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Matt Graham's medal is the third Australia’s moguls squad has delivered at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Ukrainian drone strike sparks fires at Russian Black Sea port ahead of peace talks
item.description: Two people were wounded in the attack on the port of Taman in the Krasnodar region, ahead of US-brokered peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: What is FAFO parenting and is it good for kids?
item.description: Is FAFO the 1980s parenting style today's generation of kids need, rebellion against gentle child-rearing, or exhausted parents just throwing their hands in the air?

item.title: Today in History, February 16: Steven Bradbury's Winter Olympic Games golden miracle at Salt Lake City in 2002
item.description: In 2002, Australia broke its Winter Olympics gold medal duck in the most extraordinary of ways, as Steven Bradbury put a decade of injury and bad luck behind him to claim the most thrilling of gold medals.

item.title: This week in history quiz, February 16: Can you pass the test?
item.description: Abraham Lincoln's career advice, Karl Marx's co-author and a Hollywood star's surgery: How well do you know history?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: The anxiety and joy of dual moguls bronze for Matt Graham, leader and captain of the Australian team
item.description: Matt Graham's brilliant bronze in the dual moguls, and the incredible response from his teammates, proved to everyone that he is the true leader of this Winter Olympic squad.

item.title: Liberal Party divided over future direction as Angus Taylor plots right-wing political shift
item.description: Angus Taylor says he will unite the Liberal Party, but a deeper rift is forming among those who want to overhaul the party's direction and those who believe doing so would mean political death.

item.title: ACCC takes Coles to court over 'illusory' discounts in 'case of the century'
item.description: The "case of the century" is set to play out in the federal court this month, with the ACCC taking on supermarket giant Coles for what it claims are "illusory" discounts.

item.title: AI is evolving fast and may bring the fourth industrial revolution with it
item.description: A fake news story about me, a series of AI breakthroughs, and a resignation in the tech world show that 2026 could be pivotal for AI.

item.title: Alex de Minaur claims Rotterdam Open with impressive victory over Felix Auger-Aliassime
item.description: An inspired Alex de Minaur produces one of the biggest wins of his career, lifting the Rotterdam Open title by beating red-hot Felix Auger-Aliassime.

item.title: Whooping cough cases hit record high after 'potentially catastrophic' vaccine rate drop, experts say
item.description: A "potentially catastrophic" decline in Australia's childhood vaccination rates has contributed to the sharpest increase in cases of whooping cough in 35 years, infectious diseases experts say.

item.title: As high-speed rail plans gather pace, Britain's HS2 offers hard lessons
item.description: While the federal government considers an ambitious plan, a similar project in the UK has seen its fair share of controversies.

item.title: Australia defeated by India in opening T20 as Sophie Molineux era gets off to wobbly start
item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.title: From wheels to waves in Australia's queer spaces
item.description: In places marked by historic violence and exclusion, queer communities are still showing up.

item.title: Box Hill North players' sanctions over inappropriate photos criticised as 'extremely lenient'
item.description: The Box Hill North Football Club players involved in inappropriate photos posted online after their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations have been sanctioned by the league's governing body.

item.title: Cousin of Westfield Bondi Junction attack victim feels many questions were left unanswered at inquest
item.description: A bereaved family member of victim Jade Young feels many of his questions surrounding the deadly attack and its aftermath have been left unanswered from the inquest.

item.title: Anthony Kim's LIV Adelaide victory an inspiring chapter in one of golf's most harrowing stories
item.description: American Anthony Kim, who has overcome alcohol and drug addiction, hopes his emotional win at LIV Golf's Adelaide tournament will inspire others.

item.title: Shark population may have fallen prey to algal bloom, SA ecologists fear
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom could be responsible for pushing a local population of sharks to the brink of collapse, some researchers say.

item.title: AGAIR operating licence cancelled by CASA two years after fatal Cloncurry plane crash
item.description: The family of one of the victims says its the first step towards justice for their son.

item.title: India and Pakistan refuse handshakes before and after contentious T20 World Cup clash
item.description: India and Pakistan decline to shake hands before and after the most-anticipated game of the T20 World Cup, with India easily winning by 61 runs to secure its Super 8 spot.

item.title: Cape Barren Island uses greenhouse and traditional foods to keep fridges full
item.description: A tiny island off the coast of Tasmania is embracing old and new techniques to keep food on the table.

item.title: Live: ASX set to rebound despite quiet Wall Street session
item.description: Ahead of a busy day of corporate results, the ASX is primed to recoup much of Friday's losses. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Live: Angus Taylor demands PM conduct spending audit ahead of budget
item.description: New opposition leader Angus Taylor wants the government to set up a bipartisan taskforce to find areas to trim in the upcoming budget. Follow live.

item.title: Dams and rivers run dry, forcing Victorian farmers to make tough decisions about their livestock
item.description: Victorian farmers are forced to cart water or destock as dams and rivers run dry.

item.title: Flood warnings across Qld as the state's north braces for heavy falls
item.description: All eyes are on the already-swollen waterways across Queensland, as the state's north braces for another drenching this week.

item.title: NT MLA Tanzil Rahman accused of bullying two female staffers on VAD committee
item.description: A Northern Territory politician has been accused of bullying by two female staffers while leading a parliamentary committee, the ABC can reveal.
